channel.title: R on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in R on A Hugo website

item.title: R Series: Loading Multiple Files With Folder and File Names
item.description:
Example Let’s say you have multiple files that you want to load into R and include the folder and file name in the final tibble. In this example, we have Spotify playlist data that was downloaded using Exportify. Each playlist was previously converted to .xlsx files and placed into the appropriate genre’s folder (see below).
Each playlist folder includes multiple .xlsx playlist files. The example below shows the contents inside the Country genre folder.

item.title: Final R Markdown Test
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
